intro: Quercus mindanaensis, commonly known as the Mindanao oak, is a deciduous tree native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks, beeches, and chestnuts. The plant is characterized by its broad, lobed leaves that turn yellow in the fall. It produces small, cup-shaped acorns that are an important food source for various wildlife species. This tree is well adapted to the tropical and subtropical climates of its native habitat.
